alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 9:49PM CDT until further notice by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... South Platte River near Roscoe affecting Keith and Deuel Counties. .Runoff from earlier heavy rainfall in Colorado continues to flow down the South Platte river, pushing the river at Roscoe to flood stage on Friday, followed by a second crest on Monday and lasting through the end of the forecast period. Additional heavy rainfall upstream is occurring and may affect the current crest forecast. For the South Platte River...including Roscoe...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Platte River near Roscoe. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water reaches the gage house floor. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage early Friday afternoon. It will then fall to 8.4 feet Monday morning. It will then rise above flood stage again late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.2 feet on 06/23/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun South Platte River Roscoe 9.0 8.8 Thu 7 pm MDT 9.0 8.9 8.4 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 930 AM MDT.
